channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: NSW eases COVID-19 restrictions on weddings, funerals as global cases surpass 5.8 million, Australian death toll stands at 103

item.dc:creator: Daile Cross
item.description: The Department of Health yesterday reported seven new cases of COVID-19, bringing WA's total to 577. Of these seven new cases, six are crew members from the Al Kuwait.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: More COVID-19 cases from stricken sheep ship, global cases top 5.9 million

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: race to solve mystery of Blackwater death and national cabinet meets

item.dc:creator: Jeremy Warner
item.description: Today's lockdowns do seem to mark the transition from one age to another, but not to the imagined bright new dawn.
item.title: Coronavirus is launching us into a new era of poverty, turmoil and conflict

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victorians abandoning the work-from-home effort, public transport data suggests; Keilor Downs student tests positive

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Storm coach Craig Bellamy hopes AFL diehards will follow his side for a couple of weeks, and believes the "six again" rule could prove a boon for Cameron Smith.
item.title: 'Six again' rule could help Smith, Storm: Bellamy

item.description: The book will reflect on the broadcaster's career, exploring and documenting the natural world, and the decline of the planet's environment and biodiversity he has observed.
item.title: Attenborough to set out vision for future in new book

item.dc:creator: Georgina Mitchell
item.description: The woman acted with "cruelty" after perceived misbehaviour by the child, a judge said.
item.title: Woman jailed for five years after making child drink Dettol

item.description: Researchers believe the societal conditions produced by the coronavirus lockdown provide an opportunity to break the chain of sexually transmitted infections.
item.title: Down to just one COVID-19 case, NZ is moving to stamp out STIs

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Child Safety Minister Di Farmer announced the investigation on Friday after the death of Willow Dunn and discovery of two teenage boys at a home in Stafford.
item.title: Investigation launched into 'horrific' cases of alleged child neglect

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: The man who killed Thomas Kelly in 2013 attacked the president of the Rebels Penrith chapter inside Silverwater Prison in 2018.
item.title: One punch killer Loveridge sentenced to an extra month for prison fight

item.description: Wearing only undies and ECG dots, Benedict Kearney carjacked a woman, sped down the wrong side of a road and then bit a policeman who tried to arrest him.
item.title: Alien fear led undie-clad man to carjack woman, bite cop, court told

item.description: The indictment, unsealed on Thursday in Washington's federal court, is believed to be the largest criminal enforcement action ever brought against North Korea.
item.title: North Koreans charged in wide-ranging $3.7B sanctions-busting scheme

item.description: Former Test quick Peter Siddle has signed a two-year contract with the Tasmanian Tigers.
item.title: Siddle inks two-year deal with Tasmania

item.dc:creator: Richard Baker
item.description: Former sex discrimination commissioner Elizabeth Broderick has found a deeply troubling workplace culture at Airservices Australia, the federal agency responsible for safe skies.
item.title: 'Boys' club': Inquiry finds unacceptable sexual harassment, bullying at Airservices

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Collingwood supporters have until midnight on Sunday to bid for their cardboard cut-out to be used in round two while the AFL boss has backed broadcasters to use canned noise.
item.title: Clock ticks for board Magpies fans as AFL backs canned noise

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: No one was under more scrutiny in the NRL's return game than referee Gerard Sutton. Thankfully, all the water-cooler talk on Friday is about the game itself.
item.title: 'Last night was perfect': Referee avoids spotlight in season opener

item.description: Philippe Sands encounters the sons of two high-up Nazis and discovers one still sees his murdering father as a good man.
item.title: Unravelling a troubling Nazi legacy

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: As the industry toasts the lifting of lockdown laws next week, publicans say bouncing back from the brink is not as simple as pouring a pint.
item.title: Australian pubs face a long road back after lockdown

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: The Australian Manufacturing Workers Union has called for increased government support for the sector within weeks as forward order volumes plummet and factories close.
item.title: 'When manufacturing goes, it goes': Union warns sector under pressure

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: While ski workers are unperturbed by socially-distant village life, one Falls Creek business says the stress of preparing is 'like peeling an onion'.
item.title: 'Super stoked': Seasonal snow fiends hyped for season like no other

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: Locations which may be affected from Friday morning include Albany, Bunbury, Busselton, Katanning, Mandurah, Manjimup, Margaret River, Mount Barker, Narrogin and Perth.
item.title: Storm warning: Parts of WA urged to prepare as another cold front closes in

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: The social media executive order Trump signed today is not a mortal blow to freedom of speech - but the threat of action might make Twitter back off.
item.title: Trump doesn't care if he wins his fight with Twitter, he just wants the battle

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: No charges will be laid against man who shot stepfather in head after coroner revealed older man was doomsday prepper who planned to 'go out in a blaze of glory'.
item.title: Stepson killed 'doomsday prepper' in self defence, coroner told

item.dc:creator: Katrina Strickland
item.description: Hear Konrad Marshall's cover story about the challenges of long-distance love, followed by a discussion with Good Weekend editor Katrina Strickland.
item.title: Home is where is the heart is: long-distance love affairs

item.dc:creator: Orietta Guerrera
item.description: Divisions along age and income lines were clear as readers considered a proposal to ditch means testing of the aged pension.
item.title: Young v old, investors v spenders: Readers debate a universal aged pension

item.dc:creator: Nick Galvin
item.description: Ten Australian artists, including Bill Henson, Ben Quilty and Wendy Sharpe, share what they have been working on during the coronavirus pandemic.
item.title: Portraits of the artists in isolation

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Cricket Australia has already stood down 200 staff but more pain looms with further jobs set to go.
item.title: 'Unavoidable': Cricket Australia warns of extensive job cuts

item.dc:creator: Ronny Lerner
item.description: Footy was back for one round and then it stopped. Catch up on Adelaide, the Lions, Carlton, Collingwood, Essendon and Fremantle here.
item.title: How your club is shaping up for the AFL season restart: Part one

item.dc:creator: Malcolm Knox
item.description: What a wondrous artifice this rugby league is. The teams are real, but the premiership they are playing for is, if not quite fake, not quite real either.
item.title: Echoes of Umberto as V'landys waves wand to give people what they want

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: The 35-year-old woman is in a critical condition after she was bitten on the neck and head by the big cat at the zoo on the NSW South Coast.
item.title: Lion attacks female keeper at Shoalhaven Zoo

item.dc:creator: Jocelyn Garcia
item.description: The weather bureau's winter outlook suggests the state will experience wetter than average conditions.
item.title: Warmer nights but rainy days to come in Queensland this winter

item.dc:creator: Miki Perkins
item.description: Hailed by environmental groups as the “Franklin Dam of forest legal judgements”, the court decision sets an important legal precedent by applying federal threatened species protection law to the logging industry.
item.title: Franklin Dam-like court judgement to protect Victoria's endangered species from loggers

item.dc:creator: Wendy Tuohy
item.description: 'Every woman who is offered a shift needs to be able to take that without any barrier, the barrier of childcare for women is significant for many, many households.'
item.title: Women executives demand three month extension of free childcare

item.dc:creator: Lydia Lynch
item.description: One of Brisbane's busiest bridges will be partially closed this weekend for maintenance.
item.title: Major Brisbane bridge closed this weekend, free tolls on offer

item.dc:creator: Benjamin Preiss
item.description: Businesses will face fines if they breach new health orders to continue letting staff work from home.
item.title: New order on Monday: Victorians must keep working from home

item.description: 'There are indigenous groups living in border areas who have between 40 to 80 people. They could disappear forever.'
item.title: Oona Chaplin hosts stars and tribal leaders for Amazon coronavirus fundraiser

item.description: About an hour after the death of Stanley Ho, his large clan gathered to announce the news. They were also there to send a clear message of unity.
item.title: 'She's fearless': Pansy Ho under pressure as she takes charge of $23b empire after death of gambling king

item.dc:creator: Benjamen Judd
item.description: Whether you're preparing to host or attend your very first social soirée since lockdown, follow these simple tips for a safe and enjoyable evening.
item.title: The new dinner party etiquette rules after lockdown

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Police say the 12-year-old boy was involved in a physical altercation between two groups in a Cairns suburb when he fell to the ground unconscious.
item.title: Cairns boy dead after alleged scuffle in suburban park

item.description: Slowly but not surely, the world economy is emerging from its coronavirus-enforced hibernation. But anyone expecting a quick recovery will be disappointed.
item.title: The global economy is at the 'bottom of the canyon' - now it faces a slow climb

item.dc:creator: Sam Phillips
item.description: The Eels' demolition of Brisbane on Thursday night was also the first time more than 900,000 had tuned in on free-to-air since 2016.
item.title: Broncos-Eels clash most-watched regular-season NRL game since 2014

item.description: Illustrations by the artist from The Age.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Matt Golding

item.description: The latest work by Sydney Morning Herald editorial cartoonist Cathy Wilcox.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Cathy Wilcox

item.description: Some of his best work
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Andrew Dyson

item.description: Gallery of illustrations by Sydney Morning Herald artist, Simon Letch.
item.title: The latest illustrations from artist Simon Letch

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, May 29, 2020

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: A third day of search efforts are under way to find Hervey Bay man Paul Brazier, 37, with authorities working to determine if a boat found on Thursday was his.
item.title: Boat found in search for missing fisherman

item.description: The coronavirus has allowed Vladimir Putin to expand the Russian state's involvement in its economy, but it creates some long-term issues.
item.title: The pandemic has tightened Putin's economic grip but spells trouble for the future

item.description: Economists say many of the jobs lost are never coming back, and double-digit unemployment could persist through 2021.
item.title: Job losses continue to mount in US despite reopenings
